DOC.HEAD: Perot Offering to Pay Families' Travel Expenses
DOC.TEXT: Billionaire industrialist H. Ross Perot is offering to pay travel expenses for families wishing to journey to the bedside of servicemen wounded in Panama. The Dallas businessman has extended the offer to all families of the 191 servicemen being treated at Wilford Hall Medical Center and Brooke Army Medical Center in San Antonio, said Wilford Hall spokeswoman Sgt. Debra Morrison. The 59-year-old Texan has been the recipient of several awards for public service. Perot was unavailable for comment Thursday. USAA, the San Antonio-based insurance company, also is offering money for airline tickets and hotel accommodations, said spokesman Paul Shattenberg.
